document: Chapter 5: Working with Windows and CLI Systems - Guide to Computer Forensics and Investigations, Fifth Edition

questions.question: A file system gives the OS a road map to data on a disk.
CMOS stores system configuration and date/time information when power is off.
BIOS contains programs that perform input and output at the application level.
The bootstrap process is contained in RAM.
Disk drives are made up of platters coated with optical material.
Solid-state storage devices use wear-leveling to ensure even wear of memory cells.
In Microsoft file structures, sectors are grouped to form clusters.
Clusters range from 512 bytes up to 64,000 bytes each.
Clusters are numbered sequentially starting at 0 in FAT file systems.
A partition is also known as a logical drive.
Windows OSs can have four primary partitions followed by an extended partition.
The Master Boot Record (MBR) is located on the first sector of a storage device.
GPT is an older partitioning scheme replaced by MBR.
FAT was originally designed for hard disks.
FAT16, FAT32, and exFAT are current FAT versions.
Drive slack includes RAM slack and file slack.
Fragmentation occurs when file clusters are stored contiguously.
When a FAT file is deleted, the first letter of the filename is replaced with HEX E5.
NTFS was introduced with Windows 95.
NTFS is a journaling file system that records transactions before carrying them out.
In NTFS, everything written to the disk is considered a file.
The Master File Table (MFT) is the first data set on an NTFS disk.
NTFS uses ASCII for international data formatting.
The first 15 records in the MFT are reserved for user files.
MFT records are called metadata.
Files smaller than 512 bytes are always stored outside the MFT.
Data runs provide cluster addresses where files are stored on NTFS partitions.
LCN stands for Logical Cluster Number in NTFS.
Alternate data streams can obscure evidentiary data in NTFS.
NTFS compression is similar to FAT DriveSpace 3.
EFS uses a symmetric key method for encrypting files.
EFS recovery certificates are sent to the local Windows user account.
When an NTFS file is deleted in Windows, it is immediately removed from the MFT.
ReFS is designed for very large data storage needs like the cloud.
Whole disk encryption helps prevent loss of information from stolen laptops.
Whole disk encryption tools encrypt each file separately rather than each sector.
BitLocker requires TPM version 2.0 or newer.
TrueCrypt is an example of a third-party disk encryption tool.
The Windows Registry stores hardware and software configuration information.
Virtual machines cannot be used in digital forensics.
